Description: Body sherd (mended from two fragments) of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice or Type B1 kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black (fired brown) with trace of lotus flower in added white and red; two white bands below; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of the Dioskouroi (Naukratis), Buried in sand under the west wall of Temenos.
Curator's comments: The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic elements and the absence of decoration on the interior and exterior surfaces make it impossible to determine whether it came from a kantharos or a chalice. Simple Animal Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior. Given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well. Kantharoi Type B1 have lotus flowers and lotus buds on the interior above two white bands (Williams 1983, 169).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. XXXV, no. 680)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1507) (phase 2)
